Smart Logistics for Safety & Sustainability

The transportation industry plays a major factor and provides a significant impact on the state of carbon footprint in the environment. As a tech – company, our focus has always been providing innovative supply chain and logistics solutions to meet the adverse impact of the evolving transport landscape driven by increasing city density, road network complexities, infrastructure developments, as well as changing business and industry preferences. We are driven by our goal to be the premier partner of organizations in their transport fleet resource and enterprise information management for sustainable, safe, and efficient transportation operations, as well as carbon footprint reduction.

The Digital Transformation Journey

The scope of transportation is one of the major segments in the Supply Chain industry that unfortunately is not yet fully digitized in the Philippines. Digitization and enablement of IoTs are significant in addressing connectivity and visibility elements of logistics. This prevents adverse industry business implications resulting to the usage of non-environment friendly processes and solutions.

In a fully digitized transportation setup, connectivity through IoTs and Applications (Fleet Management System, Last Mile Application, etc.) of transporters to supply chain processes prevent business disruptions. Fleet visibility optimizes the turn-around time and predictability of timeliness which increases production efficiency and product availability in the market. It also helps reduce energy utilization and unwarranted hoarding of supplies.

These digital solutions play a major role in the industry’s ecological and sustainability equation by preventing unnecessary usage of energies that impact our environment.

By using data and analytics, we believe in making a difference by providing not just an optimization tool in the market but a solution for safety and efficient transportation operations where reduction of fleet km-distance travelled and maximizing truck load fill will result to the reduction of carbon footprint.

Sustainability is not just embedded in our products and services, but it is the key output of the processes and strategies we employ within the algorithm of our solutions. Hence, sustainability, safety, and efficiency are elements equated in our strategies as we develop our systems – that which benefits our customers, the industry, and the environment.

 

In1Go Technologies, is an IT Services and BPO company providing a range of value solutions specializing in project management, salesforce management and distribution automation, location based services/marketing, supply chain and marketing enablers. We offer a suite of internet-enabled solutions including applications and systems software. We undertake projects ranging from Re-engineering, Business Operations, Web enablement, Application development, and BPO Operations.

Our software development infrastructure is based in Manila – Philippines with representative offices across the country, in Canada and Singapore. In addition to software development we offer internet solutions, call center infrastructure and services as required by our clients.

We are focused on implementing strategic solutions based on internet technologies and software services for improving business processes & making it cost effective.  Visit us  at www.in1gotech.com or  email customercare@in1go.com.ph and find out how your business can leverage on our products & services.

In1Go and AIM collaborate for data science project – [PressReader.com]

July 26, 2019

In1Go Technologies Inc., an information technology services and BPO company, has partnered with the Asian Institute of Management for a data science project that will use real data to solve real-world problems and challenges faced by businesses today. Under the Capstone collaboration, In1Go provided students of AIM’s Master of Science in Data Science program live data that they studied, analyzed and used to develop a solution model that could benefit various industries. Present at the signing ceremony held at AIM were (from left) Dr. Tahrini Garcia, chief finance officer, In1Go; Ramon Garcia, chief executive officer, In1Go; Dr. Christopher Monterola, executive director, ACCeSs@AiM and school head of AIM’s Aboitiz School of Innovation Technology and Entrepreneurship; and Dr. Erika Fille Legara, deputy director, ACCeSs@AiM and program director of AIM’s Master of Science in Data Science program.

The project aims to use information or real data to solve the company’s real-world business problems. Data from various industries are becoming more and more important for businesses to get ahead.

In1Go Technologies, Inc., an information technology services and BPO (business process outsourcing) company that provides a wide range of value solutions using the latest technologies, provided data so students in AIM’s Master of Science in Data Science program could develop a model that could lead to solutions to its business problems.

“We’re looking forward to this partnership because this is new in the industry. With data science becoming more important, we’re looking into gaining insights from the information that we have to leverage our clients’ position,” said Ramon S. Garcia, chief executive officer of In1Go.

Data In1Go shared from its clients could help develop a predictive model that the company could use internally for its projects or incorporate into its existing applications. In1Go’s clients are mostly from the fast-moving consumer good (FMCG) industry. Their data include inventories, sales, and on-shelf availability.

Data Science students from AIM studied, analyzed and worked on the live data to create a model that could benefit In1Go’s clients. Students partnered with data scientists from ACCeSs@AiM to look for patterns and gain insights from the information provided to meet In1Go’s requirements and parameters to solve its business problems.

Students used computers, machine learning and algorithms to process the data. Depending on the business objective or problem, students tried developing solutions based on the information from the data. The collaborative project also served to meet thesis requirements of AIM’s Data Science students.

“What we envision is for our students to work closely with different industries and do a practical application of data science by working hand in hand with various organizations,” said Dr. Christopher P. Monterola, executive director at ACCeSs@AiM and head of AIM’s Aboitiz School of Innovation Technology and Entrepreneurship.

The Master of Science in Data Science program is a pioneering program of AIM’s Aboitiz School of Innovation Technology and Entrepreneurship, considered the first in the Philippines and one of the firsts in Asia.

In1Go specializes in the supply chain, field and distribution management, location marketing and location-based services using state-of-the-art technologies.

Through this collaboration, In1Go hopes to use the information they have to service its clients more effectively. AIM, on the other hand, hopes to work with more industries and help them understand the advantages of using data science in today’s competitive business environment. 

www.pressreader.com

In1Go and AIM collaborate for data science project

November 23, 2017

Present at the signing ceremony held at AIM were (from left) Dr. Tahrini A. Garcia, chief finance officer of In1Go; Ramon S. Garcia, chief executive officer of In1Go; Dr. Christopher P. Monterola, executive director, ACCeSs@AiM and school head of AIM’s Aboitiz School of Innovation Technology and Entrepreneurship; and Dr. Erika Fille T. Legara, deputy director, ACCeSs@AiM and program director of AIM’s Master of Science in Data Science program.

The project aims to use information or real data to solve the company’s real-world business problems. Data from various industries are becoming more and more important for businesses to get ahead.

Students partnered with data scientists from ACCeSs@AiM to look for patterns and gain insights from the information provided to meet In1Go’s requirements and parameters to solve its business problems.

Students used computers, machine learning and algorithms to process the data. Depending on the business objective or problem, students tried developing solutions based on the information from the data. “What we envision is for our students to work closely with different industries and do a practical application of data science by working hand in hand with various organizations,” said Dr. Christopher P. Monterola, executive director at ACCeSs@AiM and head of AIM’s Aboitiz School of Innovation Technology and Entrepreneurship.

The Future of Logistics Innovation

November 23, 2017

THE PEPPER MILL – Pepper Teehankee 

(The Philippine Star ) – November 23, 2017 – 4:00pm

Eye for luxury

International luxury group Kering Eyewear presented its latest collection from seven iconic brands at The Gallery of The Peninsula Manila recently.

Bottega Veneta’s intrecciato (meticulous technique of weaving leather) is what the brand is famous for. The laser-etched intrecciato motif is seen in the acetate of the eyewear.

Puma’s collection consists of ultra-modern shapes that enhance the freedom of movement while Alessandro Michele Gucci eyewear collection is hinged on gender neutrality and eccentric decorations.

Environmentally conscious Stella McCartney uses ethically sourced materials such as bio-acetate, fibers from seeds, and conifers and broadleaves making it 100-percent eco-friendly, 100-percent biodegradable, 100-percent recyclable. Iconic French designer Yves Saint Laurent’s eyewear can be described as timeless, unisex classics that are restyled with modernity. The late Alexander McQueen’s contemporary McQ brand’s new eyewear styles are inspired by vintage Americana.

During the launch, Kering Eyewear representatives toured guests around the venue and spoke to them about the collection. They also gave recommendations on what eyewear would best suit one, based on the shape of one’s face.

A curated food selection by chef Eduardo Madela highlighted the signature look of each brand.

 (Kering Eyewear pieces will be available in leading department stores and optical shops in the Philippines soon.)

 

The future of logistics innovation

A night of music and revelry was had by the executives of In1Go Technologies Inc. as they feted friends and clients to introduce the company’s newest innovative product named 1Go Loadr.

In1Go Technologies is a 100-percent Filipino-owned IT services and BPO company that offers a suite of value enterprise solutions to industries that deal with consumer goods, petroleum, food, among others.

1Go Loadr is a web- and mobile-enabled collaborative platform (also known as an online marketplace) where both haulers and shippers converge to address the numerous delivery requirements of customers. Through a mobile app (downloadable from the Google Play Store or via the web at www.1go-load.me), haulers of varying scale can now gain access to a wide variety of items for shipment while shippers can conveniently find a reliable hauler with the right vehicle for their requirements. Over 2,000 trucks are enrolled in the system that can take loads on-demand. Security and peace of mind are also assured thanks to real time, GPS truck tracking and monitoring.

In1Go Technologies operations manager Manny Miranda said, “With our extensive experience in servicing the logistics market, we saw a need for an app like 1Go Loadr. With this, we aim to open up the space to smaller haulers by giving them access to a larger community.”

1Go Loadr hopes to help increase productivity and convenience for both haulers and shippers by delivering the future of logistics collaboration.

 

A ‘Pink’ afternoon

SM Woman honored the members of ICanServe Foundation and Bosom Buddies at #SMWomanThinkPink via a fun-filled shopping afternoon at SM Makati.

The event started with merienda followed by a short program. The afternoon was capped off with a complete  shopping experience with SM Woman stylists, who assisted guests with their personal picks.

Bunny Rano of Bosom Buddies and Irene Tumaob of ICanServe Foundation thanked SM Woman for this treat.

 (For more information, visit www.thesmstore.com and www.facebook.com/SMWoman/.)

 (Follow me on Instagram @pepperteehankee.)

www.philstar.com
